Hero.description: <bold>System architect</bold> passionate since I was 15, I design <bold>robust, scalable and intelligent</bold> infrastructures with a diagnostic-driven approach and a vision focused on sustainable impact.

Philosophy.block_1_text: - I started at <bold>15 years old</bold>, out of necessity and curiosity. I am not among those who look for quick answers; I rather hunt down root causes. I dismantle complexity to the bone to reveal architectural elegance — the kind that simplifies without betraying, that stands when everything else falters.
Philosophy.block_2_text: Rigor. Discipline. Iteration. I code like designing an airplane: every part has a function, every tolerance is measured, every risk is isolated. Nothing is left to chance. My approach is diagnostic-driven: I want states, metrics, and errors exposed to iterate quickly and well. Robustness is not an option, it's the contract.
Philosophy.block_3_text: - Real impact. No hype, no smoke and mirrors. I aim for sustainable performance — systems that hold, evolve, and create measurable value for the user. I build for the real world: constraints, scale, unforeseen events. Scalability is not a slogan, it's a responsibility.

About.title: Start Earlier,Fail earlier,improve earlier
About.subtitle: AD ASTRA PER ASPERA
About.intro: Solid architectures are born from constraint, not comfort. Here are the updates that shaped how I think, code and hold under pressure.
About.step_1_title: (Discipline, Community Life, Theory on Computer Science)
About.step_1_desc: At the seminary, I learned discipline, rigor and above all community life. This training house shaped how I coexist with others. Indeed, we had to show compromise and understand that our freedom stops where another's begins.
About.step_2_desc: In 5th grade, my father often took me to his workplace. I used the Wi‑Fi to watch tutorials on YouTube. For example, I could spend the night trying to understand binary or how networks like HTTP and SSH work.
About.step_3_desc: After the seminary, I went to the mixed high school of Goughin. This school taught me to be resilient. Indeed, there were 100 students in the second year. It was very difficult to breathe or follow classes. Despite that, I always held on because I knew sooner or later there would be a solution. I attended classes during the day and coded at night. It was especially during this period that I started programming: Python, JavaScript, React, Next.js
About.step_4_desc: Thanks to a computer science teacher (Mr. HONVOH Marcia), I was able to obtain an excellence scholarship from the Türkiye Maarif Foundation to continue my studies at this prestigious school, which is among the best in my country. It was truly a sign that my efforts were starting to pay off. Yes, it wasn't easy! Yes, there were always issues here and there. But knowing that with my work my father would no longer have to pay my tuition was very satisfying.
About.step_5_desc: Thanks to my good results in the Burkinabè baccalaureate (High Honors in Bac C), I obtained a scholarship from the Moroccan government to study at the National School of Applied Sciences of Berrechid. I am also taking courses on Coursera and at GoAi Lab to acquire the necessary skills and certifications in Artificial Intelligence, Cloud Computing and Cybersecurity. I currently aspire to become an AI Engineer, AI Researcher and Cloud Architect. No surprise, since I have trained for this since childhood. My greatest ambition is to put my knowledge at the service of the development of my country, Burkina Faso, and to show that with hard work and iron discipline one can come from anywhere and achieve the wildest dreams. As Mandela said: <bold>Maybe not today, maybe not next month, but one day I will be a champion</bold>. Let us dare to innovate, dare to dream and above all dare to make the impossible possible.<bold> After all, sky is the limit</bold>

Project_mindcare.title: MindCare
Project_mindcare.subtitle: AI-driven mental health companion & tracker.
Project_mindcare.description: Une plateforme innovante qui brise les barrières de la santé mentale grâce à une IA empathique et sécurisée.
Project_mindcare.challenge: Le manque de spécialistes et le tabou social empêchent l'accès aux soins. Il fallait créer une solution anonyme, disponible 24/7 et capable de comprendre les nuances émotionnelles.
Project_mindcare.solution: Développement d'un agent intelligent basé sur le RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) pour fournir des conseils validés cliniquement, couplé à un tableau de bord de suivi d'humeur chiffré de bout en bout.
Project_mindcare.impact: Testé par un groupe pilote de 500 utilisateurs, avec un taux de satisfaction de 92% sur la pertinence des réponses de l'IA et une amélioration notable du suivi quotidien.

Project_amira_shop.title: Amira-Shop
Project_amira_shop.subtitle: Scalable Digital Marketplace.
Project_amira_shop.description: Une plateforme de commerce électronique complète, conçue pour offrir une expérience d'achat fluide, rapide et sécurisée.
Project_amira_shop.challenge: Gérer des pics de trafic intenses tout en assurant une synchronisation parfaite des stocks et la sécurité des transactions bancaires et mobiles.
Project_amira_shop.solution: Architecture Next.js avec rendu hybride (ISR/SSR) pour un SEO maximal, intégration d'API de paiement locales et internationales, et gestion d'état ultra-performante.
Project_amira_shop.impact: Optimisation du temps de chargement de 60% par rapport aux solutions standards, permettant une augmentation du taux de conversion et une fiabilité de transaction de 99.9%.

Project_schola.title: EduTrack LMS
Project_schola.subtitle: Scalable school management system for West Africa.
Project_schola.description: A complete solution to digitize student tracking, grades and attendance in low-connectivity areas.
Project_schola.challenge: Schools lacked reliable infrastructure. The system had to work offline (Offline-First) and synchronize when the network was available.
Project_schola.solution: Use of a PWA (Progressive Web App) with a local database (IndexedDB) synchronized to PostgreSQL via an optimized GraphQL API.
Project_schola.impact: Deployed in 15 schools, managing 50,000+ students, reducing administrative paperwork by 80%.

Project_Liber.title: Liber — Digital Library
Project_Liber.subtitle: Access and reconciliation of educational resources for institutions.
Project_Liber.description: An open platform that centralizes, organizes and distributes digital educational content (textbooks, lessons, multimedia) for schools and libraries in low‑connectivity areas.
Project_Liber.challenge: Fragmented resources: local files, paper materials, incompatible formats and limited network access. The system needed to ensure availability, fast search and rights management while preserving user privacy.
Project_Liber.solution: Offline‑First architecture with progressive synchronization, metadata engine and resource reconciliation (fuzzy matching). Distribution via PWA and lightweight apps, GraphQL API for integration, fine‑grained rights management and caching/compression strategies to save bandwidth.
Project_Liber.impact: Continuous access to learning materials even offline, reduced content duplication, improved inter‑institution collaboration and time savings for teachers. Enables fairer knowledge distribution in rural areas.

Project_AgriConnect.title: AgriConnect
Project_AgriConnect.subtitle: Predictive agricultural analysis via satellite imagery.
Project_AgriConnect.description: An AI platform that analyzes satellite data (Sentinel-2) to predict crop yields and detect early drought zones.
Project_AgriConnect.challenge: Process terabytes of multispectral images with minimal latency and provide accurate predictions despite scarce local training data (ground truth).
Project_AgriConnect.solution: Computer vision pipeline (custom ResNet) with synthetic data augmentation. Deployment of optimized models (ONNX) on local servers.
Project_AgriConnect.impact: Prevented crop losses in 3 pilot regions. Increased yield by 30% thanks to targeted irrigation recommendations.

Project_fraud-detection.title: Fraud Detection
Project_fraud-detection.subtitle: Transaction analysis and anomaly detection on imbalanced datasets.
Project_fraud-detection.description: A transaction analysis system (Kaggle data) designed to surface fraudulent behavior despite the scarcity of positive examples.
Project_fraud-detection.challenge: Fraud datasets are highly imbalanced: fraudulent transactions make up a tiny fraction of records. This imbalance skews standard models and makes anomaly detection difficult without tailored strategies.
Project_fraud-detection.solution: Multi‑pronged pipeline: feature engineering, resampling (SMOTE) and class weighting, training robust models (XGBoost, LightGBM), validation using Precision‑Recall curves and threshold calibration. Added explainability (SHAP) and production metric monitoring.
Project_fraud-detection.impact: Improved sensitivity to real fraud while containing false positives; operational integration via alerts and online scoring. Repo: https://github.com/IDOEFRAIM
